qas.question: What was railway area developed into

answers.text: were developed following modernist ideas of the 1960s, in a brutalist style

qas.question: Who's ideas were used to develop Central Utrecht?
What mall was built over part of the old canal system?

plausible_answers.text: Protest against further modernisation of the city centre

qas.question: What followed the completion of the new center city buildings?

context: The area surrounding Utrecht Centraal railway station and the station itself <a0_0>were developed following <b3_0>modernist<b3_0/> ideas of the 1960s, in a brutalist style<a0_0/>. This led to the construction of <a1_0>the shopping mall <b4_0>Hoog Catharijne<b4_0/><a1_0/> (nl), music centre Vredenburg (Hertzberger, 1979), and conversion of part of the ancient canal structure into a highway (Catherijnebaan). <b5_0>Protest against further modernisation of the city centre<b5_0/> followed even before the last buildings were finalised. <a2_0>In the early 21st century the whole area is being redeveloped<a2_0/>. The music <b6_0>redeveloped music centre<b6_0/> opened in 2014 where the original Vredenburg concert and rock and jazz halls are brought together in a single building.
